إِنَّ الْحَمْدَ والنِّعْمَة لَكَ والمُلْكُ، 
لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ
duas.translation:
I am here at Your service, O Allah, I am here at Your service. 
I am here at Your service, You have no partner, I am here at Your service. 
Surely the praise, and blessings are Yours, and the dominion. 
You have no partner.
duas.transliteration:
Labbayk-Allāhumma labbayk, 
labbayka lā sharīka laka labbayk,
inna ‘l-ḥamda, wanni`mata, laka wa ‘l-mulk, 
lā sharīka lak.
duas.reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/408, Muslim 2/841.

chapters.title: The Takbîr passing the black stone

duas.arabic: طَافَ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم بِالْبَيْتِ عَلَى بَعِيرٍ كُلَّمَا أَتَى الرُّكْنَ أَشَارَ إِلَيْهِ بِشَيْءٍ عِنْدَهُ وَكَبَّرَ
duas.translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) performed Tawaf riding a camel. Every time he passed the corner (containing the Black Stone), he would point to it with something that he was holding and say:
duas.reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/476. See also 472. The 
'something' that was referred to in this Hadith was a cane.

chapters.title: Between the Yemeni corner and the black stone
chapters.arabicTitle: الدعاء بين الركن اليماني والحجر الأسود

duas.arabic:
﴿رَبَّنَا آتِنَا في الدُّنْيَا حسَنَةً
وفي الآخِرَةِ حسَنةً 
وقِنَا عذَابَ النَّارِ﴾
duas.translation:
Our Lord, grant us the good things in this world,
and the good things in the next life,
and save us from the punishment of the Fire.
duas.transliteration:
Rabbanā ātinā fid-dunyā ḥasanah 
wa fi ‘l-ākhirati ḥasanah 
wa qinā `adhāban-nār.
duas.reference:
Abu Dawud 2/179, Ahmad 3/411, Al-Baghawi, Sharhus-Sunnah 7/128. Al-Albani 
graded it good in Sahih Abu Dawud 1/354. The Ayat is from Surat Al-Baqarah, 
2:201.

chapters.title: When at Mount Safa and Mount Marwah

duas.arabic: (لَمَّا دَنَا النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم مِنَ الصَّفَا قَرَأَ: ﴿إِنَّ الصَّفَا وَالْمَرْوَةَ مِنْ شَعَآئِرِ اللَّهِ﴾ "أَبْدَأُ بِمَا بَدَأَ اللَّهُ بِهِ" فَبَدَأَ بِالصَّفَا فَرَقِيَ عَلَيْهِ حَتَّى رَأَى الْبَيْتَ، فَاسْتَقْبَلَ الْقِبْلَةَ، فَوَحَّدَ اللَّهَ وَكبَّرَهُ وَقَالَ: لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ، أَنْجَزَ وَعْدَهُ، وَنَصَرَ عَبْدَهُ، وَهَزَمَ الْأَحْزَابَ وَحْدَهُ، ثُمَّ دَعَا بَيْنَ ذلكَ. قَالَ مِثْلَ هَذَا ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ) الْحَدِيثُ. وَفِيهِ: (فَفَعَلَ عَلَى الْمَرْوَةِ كَمَا فَعَلَ عَلَى الصَّفَا)
duas.translation:
Whenever the Prophet (ﷺ) approached Mount Safa, he would recite:

Surely Safa and Marwah are among the signs of Allah. I begin by that which Allah began.

He began (his Sa'y) at Mount Safa climbing it until he could see the House. He then faced the Qiblah repeating the words:

There is none worthy of worship but Allah, and Allah is the Most Great.

Then he said:

None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner, His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, He fulfilled His Promise, He aided His slave, and He alone defeated Confederates.

Then he would ask Allah for what he liked, repeating the same thing like this three times. He did at Mount Marwah as he did at Mount Safa.
duas.transliteration: Whenever the Prophet (ﷺ) approached Mount Safa, he would recite:
duas.reference: Muslim 2/888.

chapters.title: The Day of 'Arafah

duas.arabic:
خير الدعاء دعاء يوم عرفة ، وخيرُ ما قلت أنا والنبيُّون من قبلي :
لا إله إلا الله وحدهُ
لا شريك لهُ ،
لهُ الملكُ ولهُ الحمدُ
وهو على كل شيء قدير.
duas.translation:
None has the right to be worshipped but Allah 
Alone, Who has no partner. 
His is the dominion and His is the praise,
and He is Able to do all things.
duas.transliteration:
Lā 'ilāha 'illallāhu 
waḥdahu lā sharīka lahu, 
lahul-mulku wa lahul-ḥamdu 
wa huwa `alā kulli shay'in qadīr.
duas.reference:
At-Tirmidhi. Al-Albani graded it good in Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/184, and also 
Silsilatul-'Ahadith As-Sahihah 4/6.

chapters.title: Remembrance at Muzdalifa

duas.arabic: رَكِبَ صلى الله عليه وسلم الْقَصْوَاءَ حَتَّى أَتَى الْمَشْعَرَ الْحَرَامَ فَاسْتَقْبَلَ الْقِبْلَةَ (فَدَعَاهُ، وَكَبَّرَهُ، وَهَللَّهُ، وَوَحَّدَهُ) فَلَمْ يَزَلْ وَاقِفاً حَتَّى أَسْفَرَ جِدَّاً فَدَفَعَ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَطْلُعَ الشَّمسُ.
duas.translation: 'He (ﷺ) rode Al-Qaswa until he reached Al-MashAAar Al-Haram, he then faced the qiblah, supplicated to Allah, and extoled His greatness and oneness. He stood until the sun shone but left before it rose.'
duas.reference: Muslim 2/891.

chapters.title: Takbir when throwing each pebble at the Jamarat
chapters.arabicTitle: التكبير عند رمي الجمار مع كل حصاة

duas.arabic: يُكَبِّرُ كُلَّمَا رَمَى بِحَصَاةٍ عِنْدَ الْجِمَارِ الثَّلاَثِ، ثُمَّ يَتَقَدَّمُ، ويَقِفُ يَدْعُو مُسْتَقْبِلَ الْقِبلَةِ، رَافِعاً يَدَيْهِ بَعْدَ الْجَمْرَةِ الْأُولَى وَالثَّانِيَةِ. أَمَّا جَمْرَةُ الْعَقَبَةِ فَيَرْمِيهَا وَيُكَبِّرُ عِنْدَ كُلِّ حَصَاةٍ وَيَنْصَرِفُ وَلاَ يَقِفُ عِنْدَهَا
duas.translation: The Prophet (ﷺ) said Allāhu Akbar (Allah is the Most Great) with each pebble he threw at the three pillars. Then he went forward, stood facing the Qiblah, and raised his hands and called upon Allah. That was after (stoning) the first and second pillars. As for the third, he stoned it and called out Allāhu Akbar with every pebble he threw, but when he was finished he left without standing at it (for supplications).
duas.reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 3/581, 3, 4, and Muslim

chapters.title: At times of amazement and that which delights
chapters.arabicTitle: ما يقول عند التعجب والأمر السار

duas.arabic: سُـبْحانَ الله
duas.translation: (Glory is to Allah).
duas.transliteration: Subḥānallāh!
duas.reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 1/210, 390, 414 and Muslim 4/1857.

duas.arabic: اللهُ أَكْـبَر
duas.translation: (Allah is the Most Great)
duas.transliteration: Allāhu Akbar!
duas.reference:
Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 8/441. See also Al-Albani, Sahih 
At-Tirmidhi 2/103, 235, Ahmad 5/218.

chapters.title: Upon receiving pleasant news
chapters.arabicTitle: ما يفعل من أتاه أمر يسره

duas.arabic: كَانَ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم إِذَا أَتَاهُ أَمْرٌ يَسُرُّهُ أَوْ يُسَرُّ بِهِ خَرَّ سَاجِداً شُكْراً لِلَّهِ تَبَارَكَ وَتَعَالَى
duas.translation: The Prophet (ﷺ), upon receiving news which pleased him or which caused pleasure, would prostrate in gratitude to Allah blessed and exalted.
duas.reference:
Abu Dawud, Ibn Majah, At-Tirmidhi. See also Al-Albani, Sahih Ibn Majah 
1/233, and 'Irwa'ul-Ghalil 2/226.

chapters.title: When feeling some pain in the body
chapters.arabicTitle: ما يفعل ويقول من أحس وجعاً في جسده

duas.arabic:
ضَعْ يَدَكَ عَلَى الَّذِي تَألَّمَ مِنْ جَسَدِكَ وَقُلْ:
"بِسْمِ اللَّهِ" ثَلاَثاً، 
وَقُلْ سَبْعَ مَرَّاتٍ: 
"أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ وَقُدْرَتِهِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا أَجِدُ وَأُحَاذِرُ"
duas.translation:
Put your hand on the place where you feel pain and say:
With the Name of Allah (three times).

Then say seven times:
I seek refuge in Allah and in His Power from the evil of what I find and of what I guard against.
duas.transliteration: Put your hand on the place where you feel pain and say:
duas.reference: Muslim 4/1728.

chapters.title: When startled

duas.arabic: لا إلهَ إلاّ اللّهُ
duas.translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah!
duas.transliteration: Lā ilāha illallāh!
duas.reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 6/181, Muslim 4/2208.

chapters.title: To ward off the plot of the rebellious devils
chapters.arabicTitle: ما يقول لرد كيد مردة الشياطين

duas.arabic:
أَعُوذُ بكَلِمَاتِ اللهِ التَّامَّاتِ الَّتِي لَا يُجَاوِزُهُنَّ بَرٌّ ولَا فَاجرٌ 
مِنْ شّرِّ مَا خَلقَ، 
وبَرَأَ وذَرَأَ، 
ومِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَنْزِلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ 
وِمنْ شَرِّ مَا يَعْرُجُ فيهَا، 
ومِن شَرِّ مَا ذَرَأَ في الأَرْضِ 
ومِنْ شَرِّ مَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْهَا، 
وِمنْ شَرِّ فِتَنِ اللَّيْلِ والنَّهارِ، 
ومِنْ شَرِّ كُلِّ طارِقٍ 
إِلَّا طَارِقاً يَطْرُقُ بخَيْرٍ 
يَا رَحْمَنُ
duas.translation:
I seek refuge in the Perfect Words of Allah -which neither the upright nor the corrupt may overcome -
from the evil of what He created, 
of what He made, and of what He scattered,
from the evil of what descends from the 
heavens, 
and of what rises up to them, 
from the evil of what He scattered in the earth, 
and of what emerges from it, 
from the evil trials of night and day, 
and from the evil of every night visitor,
except the night visitor who comes with good. 
O Merciful One.
duas.transliteration:
A`ūdhu bikalimāti ‘llāhit-tāmmāti ‘llatī lā yujāwizuhunna barrun wa lā fājirun
min sharri mā khalaq, 
wa bara'a wa dhara', 
wa min sharri mā yanzilu minas-samā', 
wa min sharri mā ya`ruju fīhā, 
wa min sharri mā dhara'a fi ‘l-arḍ, 
wa min sharri ma yakhruju minhā, 
wa min sharri fitani ‘llayli wannahār, 
wa min sharri kulli ṭāriqin 
illā ṭāriqan yaṭruqu bikhayr 
yā Rahmān.
duas.reference:
Ahmad 3/419, with an authentic chain of narration, and Ibn As-Sunni (no. 
637). Al-Arna'ut, graded its chain authentic in his checking of Al-'Aqidah 
At-Tahawiyyah p. 133. See also Majma'uz-Zawa'id, 10/127.

chapters.title: Seeking forgiveness and repentance

duas.arabic: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم: "وَاللَّهِ إِنِّي لأَسْتَغفِرُ اللَّهَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ فِي الْيَوْمِ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ سَبْعِينَ مَرَّةٍ"
duas.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/101.

duas.arabic: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: (يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ تُوبُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ فَإِنِّي أَتُوبُ فِي الْيَوْمِ إِلَيْهِ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ)
duas.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.reference: Muslim 4/2076.

duas.arabic: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: مَنْ قَالَ (أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ الْعَظيمَ الَّذِي لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ الْحَيُّ القَيّوُمُ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيهِ)، غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ وَإِنْ كَانَ فَرَّ مِنَ الزَّحْفِ.
duas.translation:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever says:

I seek the forgiveness of Allah the Mighty, Whom there is none worthy of worship except Him, the Living, the Eternal, 
and I repent to Him, 
Allah will forgive him even if he has deserted the army's ranks.
duas.transliteration: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.reference:
Abu Dawud 2/85, At-Tirmidhi 5/569, and Al-Hakim who declared it authentic 
and Ath-Thahabi agreed with him 1/511. Al-Albani graded it authentic in 
Sahih At-Tirmidhi 3/182. See also Jami'ul-'Usool li-'Ahdaith Ar-Rasool 4/ 
389-90 checked by Al-Arna'ut.

duas.arabic: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَقْرَبُ مَا يَكُونُ الرَّبُّ مِنَ الْعَبْدِ فِي جَوْفِ اللَّيْلِ الآخِرِ فَإِنِ اسْتَطَعْتَ أَنْ تَكُونَ مِمَّنْ يَذْكُرُ اللَّهَ فِي تِلْكَ السَّاعَةِ فَكُنْ
duas.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.reference:
At-Tirmidhi, An-Nasa'i 1/279 and Al-Hakim. See also Al-Albani, Sahih 
At-Tirmidhi 3/183, and Jdmi'ul-'Usool with Al-Arna'ut's checking 4/144.

duas.arabic: .وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَقْرَبُ مَا يَكُونُ الْعَبْدُ مِنْ رَبِّهِ وَهُوَ سَاجِدٌ فَأَكثِرُوا الدُّعَاءَ.
duas.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.reference: Muslim 1/350.

duas.arabic: .وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: إِنَّهُ لَيُغَانُ عَلَى قَلْبِي وَإِنِّي لأَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ فِي الْيَوْمِ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ.
duas.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.reference:
Muslim 4/2075. Ibn 'Athir explains that the Prophet (ﷺ) was always 
vigilant in his remembrance and drawing near to Allah, and if he forgot to 
do any of what he normally did from time to time, or it slipped his mind, 
he felt as if he had wronged himself and so he would begin to seek the 
forgiveness of Allah. See Jami'ul-'Usool 4/386.

chapters.title: Excellence of Tasbih, Tahmid, Tahlil, and Takbir
chapters.arabicTitle: من فضل التسبيح والتحميد ، والتهليل ، والتكبير

duas.arabic: قَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: مَنْ قَالَ (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ) فِي يَوْمٍ مِائَةَ مَرَّةٍ حُطَّتْ خَطَايَاهُ وَلَوْ كَانَتْ مِثْلَ زَبَدِ الْبَحْر.
duas.translation:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever says:

Glorified is Allah and praised is He.

one hundred times a day, will have his sins forgiven even if they are like the foam of the sea.
duas.transliteration: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.reference: Al-Bukhari 7/168, Muslim 4/2071, see also invocation no. 91 of this book.

duas.arabic: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: مَنْ قَالَ (لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ) عَشْرَ مِرَارٍ، كَانَ كَمَنْ أَعْتَقَ أَرْبَعَةَ أَنْفُسٍ مِنْ وَلَدِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ
duas.translation:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Whoever says:

None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. 
His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He is Able to do all things.

ten times, will have the reward for freeing four slaves from the Children of Isma'il.
duas.transliteration: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.reference: Al-Bukhari 7/67, Muslim 4/2071, see also invocation no. 93 of this book.

duas.arabic: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: كَلِمَتَانِ خَفِيفَتَانِ عَلَى اللِّسَانِ، ثَقِيلَتَانِ فِي الْمِيزَانِ، حَبِيبَتَانِ إِلَى الرَّحْمَنِ: (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ)، (سُبْحانَ اللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ)
duas.translation:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: Two words are light on the tongue, weigh heavily in the balance, and are loved by the Most Merciful One:

Glorified is Allah and praised is He, Glorified is Allah the Most Great.
duas.transliteration: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.reference: Al-Bukhari 7/168, Muslim 4/2072.

duas.arabic: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: لَأَنْ أَقُولَ (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، وَلاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ، وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ)، أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ مِمَّا طَلَعَتْ عَلَيْهِ الشَّمسُ.
duas.translation:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: For me to say:

Glory is to Allah, 
and praise is to Allah, 
and there is none worthy of worship but Allah,
and Allah is the Most Great.

is dearer to me than all that the sun rises upon (i.e. the whole world).
duas.transliteration: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.reference: Muslim 4/2072.

duas.arabic: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَيَعْجِزُ أَحَدُكُم أَنْ يَكْسِبَ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ أَلْفَ حَسَنَةٍ؟ فَسَأَلَهُ سَائِلٌ مِنْ جُلَسَائِهِ كَيْفَ يَكْسِبُ أَحَدُنَا أَلْفَ حَسَنَةٍ؟ قَالَ: يُسَبِّحُ مِائَةَ تَسْبِيحَةٍ، فَيُكتَبُ لَهُ أَلْفُ حَسَنَةٍ أَوْ يُحَطُّ عَنْهُ أَلْفُ خَطِيئَةٍ.
duas.translation: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.reference: Muslim 4/2073.

duas.arabic: مَنْ قَالَ (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ) غُرِسَتْ لَهُ نَخْلَةٌ فِي الْجَنَّةِ
duas.translation:
Whoever says:

Glorified is Allah the Most Great and praised is He.

will have a date palm planted for him in Paradise.
duas.transliteration: Whoever says:
duas.reference:
At-Tirmidhi 5/511, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic and Ath-Thahabi 
agreed 1/501. See also Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 5/531 and Sahih 
At-Tirmidhi3/160.

duas.arabic: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: يَا عَبْدَ اللَّهِ بْنَ قَيْسٍ أَلاَ أَدُلُّكَ عَلَى كَنْزٍ مِنْ كُنُوزِ الْجَنَّةِ؟ فَقُلْتُ: بَلَى يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ، قَالَ: قُلْ (لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ).
duas.translation:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: "O Abdullah bin Qais, should I not point you to one of the treasures of Paradise?" 
I said, "Yes, O Messenger of Allah." 
So he told me to say:
There is no power and no might except by Allah.
duas.transliteration: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.reference: Al-Bukhari, cf. Al-Asqalani, Fathul-Bari 11/213, Muslim 4/2076.

duas.arabic: وَقَالَ صلى الله عليه وسلم: أَحَبُّ الْكَلاَمِ إِلَى اللَّهِ أَرْبَعٌ: (سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ)، وَ(الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ)، وَ(لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ)، وَ(اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ)، لاَ يَضُرُّكَ بِأَيِّهِنَّ بَدَأتَ
duas.translation:
Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: The most beloved words to Allah are four:

Glorified is Allah, 
and
The praise is for Allah, 
and
There is none worthy of worship but Allah, 
and
Allah is the Most Great.
duas.transliteration: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said:
duas.reference: Muslim 3/1685.

duas.arabic: جَاءَ أَعْرَابِيٌّ إِلَى رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم فَقَالَ: عَلِّمْنِي كَلاماً أَقُولُهُ: قَالَ: قُلْ (لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ كَبِيراً، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ كَثِيراً، سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ العَالَمِينَ، لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَكِيمِ). قَالَ: فَهَؤُلاَءِ لِرَبِّي، فَمَا لِي؟ قَالَ: قُلْ (اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي، وَارْحَمْنِي، وَاهْدِنِي، وَارْزُقْنِي).
duas.translation:
A desert Arab came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and said, "Teach me a word that I can say. " The Prophet told him to say:

There is none worthy of worship but Allah, Who has no partner, 
Allah is the Great, the Most Great, 
and praise is to Allah in abundance, 
glory is to Allah, Lord of the worlds. 
There is no power and no might but by Allah the Mighty, the Wise.

He said, "That is for my Lord, but what about me?" The Prophet (ﷺ) told him to say:

O Allah forgive me, and have mercy on me and guide me, and provide for me.
duas.transliteration:
A desert Arab came to Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and said, "Teach me a word 
that I can say. " The Prophet told him to say:
duas.reference:
Muslim 4/2072, Abu Dawud reports the same Hadith with the addition: and 
when the Arab left, the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "He has filled his hands with 
goodness." 1/220.

duas.arabic: كَانَ الرَّجُلُ إِذَا أَسْلَمَ عَلَّمَهُ النَّبيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم الصَّلاَةَ ثُمَّ أَمَرَهُ أَنْ يَدْعُوَ بِهَؤُلاَءِ الْكَلِمَاتِ: (اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرِ لِي، وَارْحَمْنِي، وَاهْدِنِي، وَعَافِنِي وَارْزُقْنِي)
duas.translation:
Whenever anyone accepted Islam, the Prophet (ﷺ) used to teach him how to pray then he would instruct him to invoke Allah with the following words:

O Allah forgive me, and have mercy on me and guide me and give me good health and provide for me.
duas.transliteration:
Whenever anyone accepted Islam, the Prophet (ﷺ) used to teach him how to 
pray then he would instruct him to invoke Allah with the following words:
duas.reference:
Muslim 4/2073, and in one of Muslim's reports there is the addition: 'For 
these words combine [the goodness of] this world and the next.'

duas.arabic: إِنَّ أَفْضَلَ الدُّعَاءِ (الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ)، وَأَفْضَلَ الذِّكْرِ (لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ)
duas.translation:
The most excellent invocation is:

Praise is for Allah.

and the most excellent words of remembrance are:

There is none worthy of worship but Allah.
duas.transliteration: The most excellent invocation is:
duas.reference:
At-Tirmidhi 5/462, Ibn Majah 2/1249, and Al-Hakim who graded it authentic 
and Ath-Tbahabi agreed 1/503. See Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami' As-Saghir 1/362.

duas.arabic: الباقيات الصالحات : (سبحان الله) و(الحمد لله )، و(لا إله إلا الله)، و(الله أكبر) ،و (لا حول ولا قوة إلا بالله).
duas.translation:
The good deeds which endure are:

Glorified is Allah, 
and
The praise is for Allah, 
and
There is none worthy of worship but Allah,
and
Allah is the Most Great,
and
There is no power and no might except by Allah.
duas.transliteration: The good deeds which endure are:
duas.reference:
Ahmad (no. 513) (Ahmad Shakir, ed.) and its chain of narration is 
authentic. See Majma'uz-Zawa'id 1/297. Ibn Hajar mentions it in 
Bulughul-Maram saying that Ibn Hibban and Al-Hakim considered it authentic.

chapters.title: How the Prophet ﷺ made tasbeeh

duas.arabic: عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو رضي الله عنهما قَالَ: رَأَيْتُ النَّبيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم يَعْقِدُ التَّسْبِيحَ بِيَمِينِهِ.
duas.translation: Abdullah bin 'Amr (RA) said:
duas.reference:
Abu Dawud with a different wording 2/81, and At-Tirmidhi 5/521. See also 
Al-Albani, Sahihul-Jami'As-Saghir 4/271 (no. 4865).

chapters.title: Comprehensive types of good and manners

duas.arabic: إِذَا كَانَ جُنْحُ اللَّيْلِ – أَوْ أَمْسَيْتُم – فَـكُفُّوا صِبْيانَـكُم، فَإِنَّ الشَّيَاطِينَ تَنْتَشِرُ حِينَئِذٍ، فَإِذَا ذَهَبَ سَاعَةٌ مِنَ اللَّيلِ فَخَلُّوهُمْ، وَأَغْلِقُوا الأَبْوَابَ وَاذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللَّهِ؛ فَإِنَّ الشَّيطَانَ لاَ يَفْتَحُ بَاباً مُغلَقاً، وَأَوْكُوا قِرَبَكُمْ، وَاذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللَّهِ، وَخَمِّرُوا آنِيَتَكُم، وَاذْكُرُوا اسْمَ اللَّهِ، وَلَوْ أَنْ تَعْرُضُوا عَلَيْهَا شَيْئاً، وَأَطْفِئُوا مَصَابِيحَكُمْ.
duas.translation: When night falls, restrain your children (from going out) because at such time the devils spread about. After a period of time has passed, let them be. Shut your doors and mention Allah’s name, for verily the devil does not open a shut door, tie up your water-skins and mention Allah’s name, cover your vessels with anything and mention Allah’s name and put out your lamps.
duas.reference: Al-Bukhari with Al-Fath 10/88 and Muslim 3/1595.
